page.title: 15Inverarity Parish Church
page.content: Inverarity Church was built in 1754 on the site of earlier churches.It is situated close to the village at a local crossroads and is set in trees. The church is no longer used every week but on a rota with the parishes of Kinnettles and Glamis.Our local minister,the Rev. Sherrard, lives in the parish of Glamis.He is also the school chaplain. The church and grounds are well looked after.The graveyard is of historical interest as it contains many old headstones showing the trade and craft symbols of the eighteenth century.
